src_text: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

hyp_text: Tha iad a’ faicinn math gu mòr ann an dorchadas le night vision, agus a’ dol gu math leis a’ bhualadh, cuideachd. Ocelots a’ lorg a’ ghaoth aca le blàthachadh ann an cuideigin aca fhèin, agus pùntachadh air a’ ghaoth aca.

src_text: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
ref_text: Tha dà bheachd-smuaint an cumantas aig a’ mhòrchuid de mhìneachaidhean air cinnteachas teicneolais: gu bheil leasachadh an teicneolais e fhèin a’ leantainn slighe a tha gu ìre mhòr taobh a-muigh buaidh cultair no poileataigs agus gu bheil, mu seach, “buaidhean” aig an teicneolas air sòisealtasan a tha fighte a-staigh, seach fo bhuaidh an t-sòisealtais.
hyp_text: An dòigh-ghnàthachd a bhios aig mochadachan na teicneòlais tha an ceithir fiosrachadh seo: gu bheil an leasachadh ann an teicneòlais fhèin a’ dol thar an deagh-chuid air neo dhèidh a bhith ri chèile le cultar no ri riaghaltas, agus gu bheil an teicneòlais fhèin a’ dèanamh "thàthas" air choimhearsnachdan a tha ann an iomadh, a thaobh na thaobh ann an co-dhèanamh, airson a bhith.

prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
ref_text: Canar “clann air fiadhan” no fiadhaich ri clann mar seo. Chaidh cuid dhen chlann air fiadhan seo a chumail a-staigh le daoine (mar is trice am pàrantan fhèin); ann an cuid a shuidheachaidhean rinneadh seo ’s na pàrantan a’ diùltadh an dearg-chiorraim innleachdail no fhiosaigich aig duine-cloinne.
hyp_text: Tha cuid de chloinne fheòraichean air a chlàradh le daoine (gach uile uile gu h-àbhaist a bhith aca fhèin) air sgàth 'n fheadhainn sin a bha a' fuireach sa bhaile.

src_text: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.

[English]: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).

src_text: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
ref_text: Tha e furasta seo a dhèanamh le bhith a’ cleachdadh cleoc caismeachd car sàmhach a chuireas nad fhaireachadh thu gun a bhith gad dhùsgadh buileach.
hyp_text: Tha sin a' dol a bhith a' fhaighinn a dhèanamh le obair-chloiche àitheanta a bhith a' cumail tu air a bhith a' cur às dòigh gun tèid thu a dhol air an aghaidh.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
ref_text: Ma bheir thu an aire gun do dh’ath-shuidhich thu an gleoc nad chadal, gabhaidh a chàradh taobh thall an t-seòmair, a’ toirt ort èirigh às an leabaidh gus a chur dheth.
hyp_text: Ma tha thu a' leigeil a' cloc a-rithist air do leabaidh, is urrainn dha a chur air an taobh eile den bheairt, a' dìon thu bho tòir a chur air a-mach a chur a-steach.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
ref_text: Tha roghainnean eile a tha stèidhichte air a’ bheò-ruitheam a’ gabhail a-staigh mòran lionna òl (gu sònraichte uisge no tì a tha na fual-bhrosnach aithnichte) ro àm cadail a sparras ort èirigh airson mùn a dhèanamh.
hyp_text: Tha e a' gabhail a-steach cuideachd na roinnean eile a bhios a' tighinn bhon biorrhytham, mar eisimpleir, a bhith a' bruidhinn gu mòr (gus leis an uisge no tè, de dh'fhàgail a' bhruidhinn, a tha a' cur fàilte air), gu bheil duine a' cur às dhan suidheachadh.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.

hyp_text: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.

src_text: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
ref_text: Mar as ìsle an teannachd, ’s ann as fheàrr a bhios an neart beatha. Tha comas aig gach duine fìor sìth agus riarachadh iomlan a lorg.
hyp_text: Tha a' chùis a' fàs nas doimhne is a' fàs nas dòchasach an spiorad beatha a tha a' gabhail pàirt. Tha gach duine ri chumail a-mach an àm agus a' dòchas a bhith ann.

src_text: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
ref_text: Is urrainn do neach sam bith soilleireachadh a ruigsinn. Chan e ach ar frionas is smalan fhèin a tha nan seasamh san rathad air a’ cheann-uidhe seo.

src_text: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.

src_text: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
ref_text: Tha Buddhadhachd nan Tibeiteach gu math sìmplidh ann am prionnsabal. Na lùib, tha Iòga Kundalini, dian-mheòrachadh agus rathad a’ ghaoil uile-ghabhalach.
hyp_text: Tha an tòiseachadh aig a’ Bhuddhachd Tibetach gu math neo-ghràda. Is e Kundalini Yoga, meadhanachd agus loidhne a’ mhìltein a bhios ann.

src_text: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
ref_text: Ann an kundalini yoga, tha an lùthas kundalini (lùthas an t-soillseachaidh) ga dhùsgadh slighe seasamhan yoga, eacarsaich analachaidh, mantrathan agus lèirsinneachaidhean.

src_text: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
ref_text: S e nàmhaid an cumantas a bha sa Ghearmailt san dàrna cogadh agus dh’adhbharaich seo co-obrachadh eadar an USSR agus SAA. Nuair a thàinig an cogadh gu crìoch, chaidh an dà dhùthaich a-mach air a chèile an cois còmhstri nan siostaman, pròiseasan is cultaran.
hyp_text: An t-Suain is Aimearaga a bha a' dol an sàs anns an Dàrna Cogadh, agus a' dèanamh a-mach gu robh iad a' gabhail pàirt ann an co-bhanntachd. An dèidh a' chogaidh, bha an iomadachadh eadar an t-sreathan, an t-obraichean agus an cultar a' toirt an dà chuid nan dùthchannan a-mach a chèile.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
ref_text: Bha na seann chaidreabhaich nan nàimhdean a-nis dà bhliadhna an dèidh crìoch a’ chogaidh agus thòisich an Cogadh Fuar.
hyp_text: Le dà bhliadhna às dèidh an t-atharrachaidh, bha na co-chomhairlichean an-dràsta na dithis, agus thòisich an Cogadh Fuar.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref_text: Mhaireadh e airson an 40 bliadhna ri thighinn agus bhiodh còmhstrithean dha-rìribh ann, le armailtean progsaidh, air blàir-chatha o Afraga gu Àisia, ann an Afganastan, Cùba agus iomadh àite eile.
hyp_text: Bha e seo a' tighinn airson na 40 bliadhna seo a chaidh agus bhiodh e a' gabhail a-steach le h-armadan ann an dàrna còigear, air mòran àiteachan, an Afaganastan, an Cùba agus mura eile.

Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic

[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
ref_text: Chan fhaod ach dà luach a bhith aig àireamh bhìnearaidh, sin 0 no 1, agus canar figearan bìnearaidh ris na h-àireamhan seo – no biodan ann an sgleò-chainnt muinntir nan coimpiutairean.
hyp_text: Faraichean aonadachach, is iad na n-ùraichean seo a chuireas ri aon de dhà fharsaingeachd, is iad na bitichean a’ chomharrachadh ann an còmhlan-ciùil.

src_text: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.

hyp_text: Tha fiosrachadh aig a h-uile duine mu bheatha na blogaichean. Tha e air a tharraing a-steach còrr is 150 millean blogaichean air feadh an t-saoghail, agus tha a h-uile duine a tha a' fuireach ann an dùthaich sam bith a' coimhead air na blogaichean. Tha iad a' gabhail pàirt ann an dòighean eadar-dhealaichte airson a bhith a' leasachadh na h-obrach aca fhèin, a' bruidhinn ri chèile, agus a' leantainn na h-obrach a tha a' tighinn a-mach.

src_text: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.

src_text: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
ref_text: Is e na Sundarbans an crios mangrove as motha san t-saoghal a tha an cois na mara, agus e a’ sìneadh 80 km (50 mi) a-steach do chùl-tìr Bhangladeis agus nan Innseachan.
hyp_text: Tha na Sundarbans am fear as motha de chùl-mhuir fhàsach ann an an t-saoghal, a' fàs 80 km (50 m) a-steach gu còmhlan Bangladeshi agus anns an Ìnd a bha aig a' chost.

src_text: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
ref_text: Tha na Sundarbans air an ainmeachadh mar Làrach Dualchais Cruinne UNESCO. Theirear Pàirc Nàiseanta Sundarbans ris a’ bhad den choille a tha am broinn crìochan Innseanach.

src_text: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.

src_text: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.

hyp_text: Tha seannach a’ Fhàclainn a’ bhuidheachd aig na h-Eileanan Siar a bhith na phunt Fhàclainn (FKP) a tha a’ còrdadh a’ bhuidheachd a’ phunt a’ Bhreatainn (GBP).
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
ref_text: Gabhaidh airgead atharrachadh aig an aon bhanca sna h-eileanan a tha suidhichte ann an Stanley mu choinneamh bùth FIC West.
hyp_text: Tha airgead a' gabhail a-mach aig an ainmheachd a-muigh a' bhaile amhain anns na h-eileanan, a tha a' fosgladh ann an Stanley a tha air a bhith a' fosgladh a-mach a' phost-a-mhàil a' seachdainn a-mhàin.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
ref_text: Gabhar ri notaichean Breatannach àite sam bith air an eilean mar is trice agus gabhar ri cairtean-creideis agus dolaran nan Stàitean Aonaichte ann an Stanley gu tric cuideachd.
hyp_text: Bidh Puntan Rìoghail Bhreatainn a chumail a-mach mar phàirt de bhòrd mòr, agus tha gach taigh-bìdh a’ gabhail na Puntan Rìoghail Bhreatainn agus na Dollaran Ameireaganach.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
ref_text: Tha teans mòr nach gabhar ri cairtean-creideis air na h-eileanan a-muigh ach dh’fhaoidte gun gabh iad ri airgead Bhreatainn is nan Stàitean Aonaichte; faighnich dhe na sealbhadairean ro làimh dè na dòighean pàighidh ris an gabh iad.
hyp_text: Air na h-eileanan a-muigh, mar as trice, cha bhi carachd aca ri fhaighinn, ach 's ann uaireigin le cruinn a-nis a dh'fhaighinn. Tha cuideachd na stàitean Aonaichte a' cumail air a' chruinn a-nis.
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Scottish Gaelic
[English]: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
[Scottish Gaelic]:

src_text: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

hyp_text: Tha e nas eadar-dhealaichte a chur Falkland a chur seachad a-mach à nan eileanan, mar sin, cur airgid a chur seachad roimhe a leigeil nan eileanan.

src_text: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.

src_text: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.

src_text: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.

hyp_text: Tha an geamhradh a’ buntainn gu mionaideach: chan eil teodh ri beagan a’ dol taobh a-staigh, ach tha an fuachd agus an umha a’ cur air a’ bhogadh gu bheil e nas fheàrr na tha an teodh a’ moladh.

[Scottish Gaelic]:

hyp_text: Buidheann chèile na coille, mar sin cuideachd anns na sgìrean eile san Mheadan Fhàinne, tha iad a' togail a bharrachd air bhruidhinn, air nathair agus air bhòrd (gus an tè a tha a' dèanamh iomadh uisge), agus tha siùcar a' tighinn a-mach a chionn 's gun robh a' mhòr-chuid de na h-uile uisge.
